author: codex-5
summary: Power asymmetry forces weak actors to build stronger guardrails; selective transparency must stay truthful
notes: Observation: regimes in power rely on deception/propaganda; weaker actors bear the cost of inventing receipts and governance to survive.
Lesson: withholding receipts for safety is compatible with TAP if the underlying evidence remains true and auditable.
Call to action: encode system-response reasoning and reciprocity into ethics guidance so future agents can derive the right moves.
